channel.title: Comments on: 2010 Webby Awards – 50 Winning Sites

item.title: By: Melissa Risk
item.dc:creator: Melissa Risk
item.description: Very nice post keep it up!

item.title: By: John Asbury
item.dc:creator: John Asbury
item.description: lots of flash, but still looking good
item.content:encoded: lots of flash, but still looking good

item.title: By: Vlad Carp
item.dc:creator: Vlad Carp
item.content:encoded: uhuu..jim carrey’s site it’s scaryy )

item.title: By: Jim Ramsden
item.dc:creator: Jim Ramsden
item.content:encoded:
@Ben – It’s a pretty uninspiring collection of sites IMO. Some of them have been kicking about for a few years. Leads me to wonder what criteria each category is judged on. :/

@daniel yes lots of flash! It looks like thats the only way to a Webby. Although it will be interesting to see the difference next year, given the increasing use of CSS/jQuery and lack of flash support for iPad/iPhone.

Did you see what Steve Jobs wrote on the apple blog?

item.title: By: Daniel Pereira
item.dc:creator: Daniel Pereira
item.description:
Congratulations to those who won! Alot of flash sites which is quite disappointing :-(
Jim Carrey's site is pretty serious! Have always been fond of the mint.com site
Thanks Jim!
item.content:encoded:
Congratulations to those who won! Alot of flash sites which is quite disappointing

Jim Carrey’s site is pretty serious! Have always been fond of the mint.com site

Thanks Jim!

item.title: By: Ben Bush
item.dc:creator: Ben Bush
item.description: Can't really say I'm completely bowled over by most of these sites, it's a given though some of the content is great on these sites and still loving the They Make Apps navigational structure and design but HBO's load time could be considered slow which is intrusive to the user experience. Hell what do I know anyway ;-)
item.content:encoded: Can’t really say I’m completely bowled over by most of these sites, it’s a given though some of the content is great on these sites and still loving the They Make Apps navigational structure and design but HBO’s load time could be considered slow which is intrusive to the user experience. Hell what do I know anyway
